fields.name: cert
fields.description: Configurations associated with `crypto:TrustStore` or single certificate file that the client trusts

fields.name: tlsVersions
fields.description: The TLS versions to be used

records.name: ClientSecureSocket
records.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote ldap server.

fields.name: hostName
fields.description: The host name of the Active Directory server

fields.name: port
fields.description: The port of the Active Directory server

fields.name: domainName
fields.description: The domain name of the Active Directory

fields.name: password
fields.description: The password of the Active Directory

records.name: ConnectionConfig
records.description: Provides a set of configurations to connect with a directory server.

records.name: Control
records.description: LDAP control type.

records.name: DcObject
records.description: A record for an entry to contain domain component information

records.name: Entry
records.description: LDAP entry type.

records.name: ErrorDetails
records.description: The error details type for the Ballerina LDAP module.

fields.name: matchedDN
fields.description: The matched DN from the response

fields.name: resultCode
fields.description: The operation status of the response

fields.name: diagnosticMessage
fields.description: The diagnostic message from the response

records.name: LdapResponse
records.description: LDAP response type.

records.name: Person
records.description: A record for an entry that represents a person.

records.name: SearchReference
records.description: LDAP search reference type.

fields.name: resultCode
fields.description: The result status of the response

fields.name: entries
fields.description: The entries returned from the search

records.name: SearchResult
records.description: LDAP search result type.

parameters.name: dN
parameters.description: The distinguished name of the entry

parameters.name: entry
parameters.description: The information to add

returnParameters.description: A `ldap:Error` if the operation fails or `ldap:LdapResponse` if successfully created

remoteMethods.name: add

parameters.name: dN
parameters.description: The distinguished name of the entry to remove

returnParameters.description: A `ldap:Error` if the operation fails or `ldap:LdapResponse` if successfully removed

remoteMethods.name: delete
remoteMethods.description:
Removes an entry in a directory server.

```ballerina
ldap:LdapResponse result = check ldapClient->delete(userDN);
```

parameters.name: dN
parameters.description: The distinguished name of the entry

parameters.name: entry
parameters.description: The information to update

returnParameters.description: A `ldap:Error` if the operation fails or `LdapResponse` if successfully updated

remoteMethods.name: modify

parameters.name: currentDn
parameters.description: The current distinguished name of the entry

parameters.name: newRdn
parameters.description: The new relative distinguished name

parameters.name: deleteOldRdn
parameters.description: A boolean value to determine whether to delete the old RDN

returnParameters.description: A `ldap:Error` if the operation fails or `ldap:LdapResponse` if successfully renamed

remoteMethods.name: modifyDn
remoteMethods.description:
Renames an entry in a directory server.

```ballerina
ldap:LdapResponse modifyDN = check ldapClient->modifyDn(userDN, "CN=Test User2", true);
```

parameters.name: dN
parameters.description: The distinguished name of the entry

parameters.name: attributeName
parameters.description: The name of the target attribute for which the comparison is to be performed

parameters.name: assertionValue
parameters.description: The assertion value to verify within the entry

returnParameters.description: A `boolean` value indicating whether the values match, or an `ldap:Error` if the operation fails

remoteMethods.name: compare
remoteMethods.description:
Determines whether a given entry has a specified attribute value.

```ballerina
boolean compare = check ldapClient->compare(userDN, "givenName", "New User");
```

parameters.name: dN
parameters.description: The distinguished name of the entry

parameters.name: targetType
parameters.description: Default parameter use to infer the user specified type

returnParameters.description: An entry result with the given type or else `ldap:Error`

remoteMethods.description:
Gets information of an entry.

anydata value = check ldapClient->getEntry(userDN);

parameters.description: The base distinguished name of the entry

parameters.description: The filter to be used in the search

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the search

parameters.name: targetType
parameters.description: Default parameter use to infer the user specified type

returnParameters.description: An array of entries with the given type or else `ldap:Error`

remoteMethods.name: searchWithType
remoteMethods.description:
Returns a list of entries that match the given search parameters.

```ballerina
anydata[] value = check ldapClient->searchWithType("DC=ldap,DC=com", "(givenName=New User)", ldap:SUB);
```

parameters.name: baseDn
parameters.description: The base distinguished name of the entry

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter to be used in the search

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the search

returnParameters.description: An `ldap:SearchResult` if successful, or else `ldap:Error`

remoteMethods.name: search
remoteMethods.description:
Returns a record containing search result entries and references that match the given search parameters.

```ballerina
ldap:SearchResult value = check ldapClient->search("DC=ldap,DC=windows", "(givenName=New User)", ldap:SUB);
```

remoteMethods.name: close
remoteMethods.description:
Unbinds from the server and closes the LDAP connection. 

```ballerina
ldapClient->close();
```

returnParameters.description: A boolean value indicating the connection status

remoteMethods.name: isConnected
remoteMethods.description:
Determines whether the client is connected to the server.

```ballerina
boolean isConnected = ldapClient->isConnected();
```

unionTypes.name: AttributeType
unionTypes.description: Attribute type of an LDAP entry.

enums.name: ObjectClass
enums.description: Standard values for ObjectClass attribute type.

members.name: BASE
members.description: Indicates that only the entry specified by the base DN should be considered

members.name: ONE
members.description: Indicates that only entries that are immediate subordinates of the entry specified by the base DN (but not the base entry itself) should be considered

members.name: SUB
members.description: Indicates that the base entry itself and any subordinate entries (to any depth) should be considered

members.name: SUBORDINATE_SUBTREE
members.description: Indicates that any subordinate entries (to any depth) below the entry specified by the base DN should be considered, but the base entry itself should not be considered, as described in [draft-sermersheim-ldap-subordinate-scope](https://docs.ldap.com/specs/draft-sermersheim-ldap-subordinate-scope-02.txt)

members.name: SUCCESS
members.description: The operation was successful

members.name: OPERATIONS_ERROR
members.description: The operation failed due to an unexpected order relative to other operations on the same connection

members.name: PROTOCOL_ERROR
members.description: Represents the LDAP protocol error

members.name: TIME_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
members.description: Represents the time limit exceeded error

members.name: SIZE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
members.description: Represents the error for exceeding the upper bound for the number of response entries

members.name: COMPARE_FALSE
members.description: Entry exists, attribute found, but no matching value

members.name: COMPARE_TRUE
members.description: Entry exists, attribute found, and matched the provided value

members.name: AUTH_METHOD_NOT_SUPPORTED
members.description: Represents the error for unsupported or disallowed authentication mechanism

members.name: STRONGER_AUTH_REQUIRED
members.description: Requires a stronger form of authentication

members.name: REFERRAL
members.description: The request can't be processed as issued. Try a different server or update the target location in the DIT

members.name: ADMIN_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
members.description: Administrative limit exceeded

members.name: UNAVAILABLE_CRITICAL_EXTENSION
members.description: Critical control could not be fulfilled

members.name: CONFIDENTIALITY_REQUIRED
members.description: The server requires a secure connection to process the requested operation

members.name: SASL_BIND_IN_PROGRESS
members.description:
The server has completed a portion of the processing for the provided SASL bind request, 
but that it needs additional information from the client to complete the authentication

members.name: NO_SUCH_ATTRIBUTE
members.description: Attribute that does not exist in the specified entry

members.name: UNDEFINED_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE
members.description: The request attempted to provide one or more values for an attribute type that is not defined in the server schema

members.name: INAPPROPRIATE_MATCHING
members.description: The search request attempted a type of matching that is not supported for the specified attribute type

members.name: CONSTRAINT_VIOLATION
members.description: The requested operation would have resulted in an entry that violates some constraint defined within the server

members.name: ATTRIBUTE_OR_VALUE_EXISTS
members.description: The requested operation would have resulted in an attribute in which the same value appeared more than once

members.name: INVALID_ATTRIBUTE_SYNTAX
members.description:
The requested operation would have resulted in an entry that had at least one attribute value 
that does not conform to the constraints of the associated attribute syntax.

members.name: NO_SUCH_OBJECT
members.description: The requested operation targeted an entry that does not exist within the DIT (Directory Information Tree).

members.name: ALIAS_PROBLEM
members.description: Error occurred while attempting to dereference an alias during search processing

members.name: INVALID_DN_SYNTAX
members.description: The request included a malformed entry DN

members.name: ALIAS_DEREFERENCING_PROBLEM
members.description: The server encountered an alias while processing the request and that there was some problem related to that alias.

members.name: INAPPROPRIATE_AUTHENTICATION
members.description: Attempt to bind in an inappropriate manner that is inappropriate for the target account

members.name: INVALID_CREDENTIALS
members.description: Attempt to bind with a set of credentials that cannot be used to authenticate

members.name: INSUFFICIENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS
members.description: Requested operation does not have the necessary access control permissions

members.name: BUSY
members.description: The requested operation cannot be processed because the server is currently too busy

members.name: UNAVAILABLE
members.description: The server is currently not available to process the requested operation

members.name: UNWILLING_TO_PERFORM
members.description: The server is not willing to process the requested operation for some reason

members.name: LOOP_DETECT
members.description: The server detected some kind of circular reference in the course of processing an operation

members.name: NAMING_VIOLATION
members.description: The requested operation would have resulted in an entry that violates some naming constraint within the server

members.name: OBJECT_CLASS_VIOLATION
members.description:
The requested operation would have resulted in an entry that has an inappropriate set of object classes,
or whose attributes violate the constraints associated with its set of object classes

members.name: NOT_ALLOWED_ON_NON_LEAF
members.description: The requested operation is only supported for leaf entries, but the targeted entry has one or more subordinates

members.name: NOT_ALLOWED_ON_RDN
members.description: the requested modify operation would have resulted in an entry that does not include all of the attributes used in its RDN

members.name: ENTRY_ALREADY_EXISTS
members.description: The requested operation would have resulted in an entry with the same DN as an entry that already exists in the server

members.name: OBJECT_CLASS_MODS_PROHIBITED
members.description: The requested modify operation would have altered the target entrys set of object classes in a way that is not supported

members.name: AFFECTS_MULTIPLE_DSAS
members.description: The requested operation would have required manipulating information in multiple servers in a way that is not supported

members.name: OTHER
members.description: Represents other errors.

enums.name: Status
enums.description: Represents the status of the operation

modules.summary: LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) is a vendor-neutral software protocol for accessing and maintaining distributed directory information services. It allows users to locate organizations, individuals, and other resources such as files and devices in a network. LDAP is used in various applications for directory-based authentication and authorization.
modules.description:
## Overview

LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) is a vendor-neutral software protocol for accessing and maintaining distributed directory information services. It allows users to locate organizations, individuals, and other resources such as files and devices in a network. LDAP is used in various applications for directory-based authentication and authorization.

The Ballerina LDAP module provides the capability to efficiently connect, authenticate, and interact with directory servers. It allows users to perform operations such as searching for entries, and modifying entries in an LDAP directory, providing better support for directory-based operations.

## Client

The `ldap:Client` connects to a directory server and performs various operations on directories. Currently, it supports the generic LDAP operations; `add`, `modify`, `modifyDN`, `compare`, `search`, `searchWithType`, `delete`, and `close`.

### Instantiate a new LDAP client

```ballerina
import ballerina/ldap;

public function main() returns error? {
    ldap:Client ldapClient = check new ({
        hostName,
        port,
        domainName,
        password
    });
}
```

### Remote methods in `ldap:Client`

- **add**: Creates an entry in a directory server.
- **modify**: Updates information of an entry in a directory server.
- **modifyDN**: Renames an entry in a directory server.
- **compare**: Determines whether a given entry has a specified attribute value.
- **search**: Returns a record containing search result entries and references that match the given search parameters.
- **searchWithType**: Returns a list of entries that match the given search parameters.
- **delete**: Removes an entry from a directory server.
- **close**: Unbinds from the server and closes the LDAP connection.

#### Add a new entry in the directory server

Creates an entry in a directory server.

```ballerina
anydata user = {
    "objectClass": "user",
    "sn": "New User",
    "cn": "New User",
    "givenName": "New User",
    "displayName": "New User",
    "userPrincipalName": "newuser@ad.windows",
    "userAccountControl": "544"
};
ldap:LdapResponse addResult = check ldapClient->add("DC=ldap,DC=com", user);
```

#### Search for an entry in the directory server

Returns a record containing search result entries and references that match the given search parameters.

```ballerina
ldap:SearchResult searchResult = check ldapClient->search("DC=ldap,DC=com", "(givenName=Test User1)", ldap:SUB);
```

#### Modify a new entry in the directory server

Updates information of an entry.

```ballerina
anydata user = {
    "sn": "User",
    "givenName": "Updated User",
    "displayName": "Updated User"
};
ldap:LdapResponse modifyResult = check ldapClient->modify("DC=ldap,DC=com", user);
```

#### Delete an entry in the directory server

Removes an entry from a directory server.

```ballerina
ldap:LdapResponse deleteResult = check ldapClient->delete("DC=ldap,DC=com");
```

## Examples

The Ballerina Ldap library provides practical examples illustrating usage in various scenarios. Explore these [examples](https://github.com/ballerina-platform/module-ballerina-ldap/tree/master/examples).

1. [Access directory server](https://github.com/ballerina-platform/module-ballerina-ldap/tree/master/examples/access-directory-server)
    This example shows how to integrate with a directory server to manage employees in a corporation.

2. [Manage entries in a library](https://github.com/ballerina-platform/module-ballerina-ldap/tree/master/examples/library-managment-system)
    This example demonstrates how to integrate with a directory server for managing users and books in a library.

LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) is a vendor-neutral software protocol for accessing and maintaining distributed directory information services. It allows users to locate organizations, individuals, and other resources such as files and devices in a network. LDAP is used in various applications for directory-based authentication and authorization.
